product_title: Nordic Ware Procast, Classic Scone, Graphite Scottish Scone and Cornbread Pan

product.title: Nordic Ware Procast, Classic Scone, Graphite Scottish Scone and Cornbread Pan
product.title_excluding_variant_name: Nordic Ware Procast, Classic Scone, Graphite
product.description: Nordic Ware genuine Bundt® pans are made of durable cast aluminum to achieve the most crisp, intricate cake detail possible. Cast aluminum’s superior heat conductivity ensures controlled, even browning of cakes and treats. Premium silicone nonstick is made without PFAS and PTFE for healthy baking and ensures effortless release and cleanup. Oven safe to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. A great pan for making full-sized scones, biscuits, and hearty cornbread. Pan exterior is 9.7 inch diameter, 1.2 inches in height and measures 10.6 inches handle to handle. The pan capacity holds 4.5 cups within 8 cavities. Each cavity measurements are shown in the dimensional drawing image. Mixes and recipes may vary. Fill the pan no more than 3/4 full to avoid overflow. Proudly American Made since 1946, our heirloom-quality pieces are made to withstand a lifetime of use in your home kitchen.

amazons_choice.keywords: in Bundt Pans by Nordic Ware

top_reviews.title: Great Pan
top_reviews.body: Great and easy to use. Plus you get uniform sizes and shapes when making scones or cornbread. It is a nice addition to my baking pans collection.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Great and easy to use. Plus you get uniform sizes and shapes when making scones or cornbread. It is a nice addition to my baking pans collection.

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024

top_reviews.title: Truly Non-Stick
top_reviews.body: I was previously cutting scones into triangles and baking them on a sheet - but they'd spread during cooking and I'd interrupt the baking every 5-10 minutes to try and reshape them with a spatula; they still spread on the sheet. Finally decided to buy one of these pans, even though they're pricey. I can honestly say I love this pan! I recently bought a second one so I can make double batches of scones - they don't last long in our house ;) I don't grease or flour them at all - and the scones fall right out when they're done baking - and they're perfectly shaped & cook evenly! I've made about a dozen batches and they're still just as non-stick as they were when they were new. We prefer slightly drier/denser scones so my recipe doesn't yield a sticky dough; perhaps people who have issues with sticking are using a stickier dough...? I don't know but I think the pans are wonderful. Haven't made cornbread yet - but would be interesting to try. Clean up is super easy - I just use warm water and my fingers, with a touch of mild dish soap then wipe dry. Since nothing sticks to them, it takes very little effort to clean them after use. Nordic Ware has a new fan :)Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
I was previously cutting scones into triangles and baking them on a sheet - but they'd spread during cooking and I'd interrupt the baking every 5-10 minutes to try and reshape them with a spatula; they still spread on the sheet. I've made about a dozen batches and they're still just as non-stick as they were when they were new. We prefer slightly drier/denser scones so my recipe doesn't yield a sticky dough; perhaps people who have issues with sticking are using a stickier dough...? I don't know but I think the pans are wonderful. Haven't made cornbread yet - but would be interesting to try. Clean up is super easy - I just use warm water and my fingers, with a touch of mild dish soap then wipe dry. Since nothing sticks to them, it takes very little effort to clean them after use. Nordic Ware has a new fan :)

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2020

top_reviews.title: Terrific pan
top_reviews.body: I ordered this product when we started baking scones. I did not want to shape them by hand. This pan allows them to all be uniform in size and shape, which makes them easiedr to bake. The instructions say to use Pam with Flour, and this helps the pan release the scones without breaking and with little residue left. A quick soak in soap and water and the sturdy pan is good as new with just a little pass with a plastic scrungee or sponge to get into the corners to make sure it is clean (fingers work, too). This is no heavy scrubbing needed. I would recommend this and I am thinking of getting the mini-scone version of this same pan so I can make more scones (16) instead of just 8, as we are eating these so often that the three of us go through all of them in less than a week.Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2024

top_reviews.title: Great Pan!
top_reviews.body: I received the pan the day after I ordered it, which was wonderful because I was excited about making scones for the 1st time. Although I read reviews that scones pop out easily from this pan without any prepping of the pan, I greased the pan as recommended by the instructions that came with the pan. I made blueberry scones, and a pan of breakfast of scones. Both types of scones slid nicely out of the pan. I learned a nice tip: if the recipe calls for butter, put the butter in the freezer while combining the dry ingredients, and then grate the butter before adding to the dry ingredients. I used a pastry cutter to incorporate the butter into the dry ingredients. So easy. It prevents overworking the dough and it resulted in light and absolutely delicious scones. I’ve never had better scones!Read more
top_reviews.body_html:

I made blueberry scones, and a pan of breakfast of scones. Both types of scones slid nicely out of the pan. I learned a nice tip: if the recipe calls for butter, put the butter in the freezer while combining the dry ingredients, and then grate the butter before adding to the dry ingredients. I used a pastry cutter to incorporate the butter into the dry ingredients. So easy. It prevents overworking the dough and it resulted in light and absolutely delicious scones. I’ve never had better scones!

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2024

top_reviews.title: Makes great traditional sized scones
top_reviews.body: This was my first foray into making scones and the recipe seemed to make a relatively wet dough. It was a bit challenging to place the dough in the scone pan but it produced excellent results. I'm thinking that perhaps it wasn't really a necessary purchase but now that I have it, it's time to make many more scone varieties.Read more

top_reviews.title: Cumple fantásticamente con su cometido
top_reviews.body: La calidad de Nordic Ware no está a discusión. Punto. Solo te aconsejo reflexionar si realmente necesitas un molde para scones (aunque también sirve para polenta y cornbread). Si tu respuesta es sí, ríndete y llévatelo. Si tu respuesta es no, ¿qué haces leyendo esta reseña?Read more

top_reviews.title: It’s a great pan…BUT…
top_reviews.body: I love the Nordic Ware ranges and have tons of items. Recent orders have not been satisfactory though. I’ve had 3 items arrive in the last 2 months that look like they are factory seconds. Amazon have been great a replacing, but I get the feeling that quality control is not what it was.Read more
